intro: Croton villosus, commonly known as the hairy croton, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive, often hairy foliage and bright, showy flowers that range from yellow to red. The plant belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. Croton villosus typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are usually alternate, ovate to elliptic in shape, and often have a waxy texture.
